intro: Renschia, commonly known as the star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Renschia flaccida, which is native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their tall, erect stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer.
